Subject: RE: OPR Matter (following up on our recent conversation) 
We're glad that information is helpful, and we appreciate you checking in with us on this — thank you. We do not believe 
that asking victims about their past contacts with the USAO-SDFL and FBI-MIA in or about 2005-2008 would present any 
issues for our office, we would just respectfully ask that any such discussions avoid addressing the substance of the 
underlying criminal scheme (including the victims' personal experiences and interactions with Epstein or his associates). 
And if those topics unavoidably arise despite not having been raised by OPR, we'd ask that you please let us know so we 
can incorporate any such witness statements as 3500 material as appropriate and required. But please let us know if that 
poses any issues on your end. 
thanks again, 
Assistant U.S. Attorney 
Southern District of New York

Thank you, M. This is sufficient; no need for you to do anything further. 
I want to assure you that in reaching out to and possibly interviewing the victims regarding their past contacts with the 
USAO-SDFL and FBI-MIA, OPR wishes to in no way interfere with anything your office may be doing currently or 
anticipates doing in the future. Please confirm that our doing so does not present any issues for your office. If you have 
any concerns in that regard, please let me know so we can discuss the matter. I hope I might hear back from you by 
midday Wednesday if possible. 
Best regards,

Thanks for following up, and as discussed we are able to advise OPR regarding the individuals on your list whom we 
understand to be represented by counsel. I'm happy to speak with you via phone at your convenience, but in the first 
instance, because the overwhelming majority of the individuals on your list are represented by counsel, attached is a 
spreadsheet with the relevant information. The spreadsheet represents our best and current understanding—it is of 
course possible that individuals have changed their counsel very recently, but this should hopefully at least get you 
started. 
As reflected in the spreadsheet, of the 32 individuals you listed, 22 are represented by Brad Edwards, of Edwards Pottinger 
LLC; two are represented by Jack Scarola, of Searcy Law; one is represented by Sigrid McCawley, of Boies Schiller; one is 
represented by Rita Glavin, of Seward & Kissel LLP, and one is represented by Gloria Allred, of Allred, Maroko & Goldberg. 
Of the remaining five, four we have been unable to connect with (at least at the AUSA level), and one we believe is 
deceased. The contact information for the attorneys is the following: 
Brad Edwards 
Jack Scarola 
Sigrid McCawley 
Rita Glavin 
Gloria Allred 
Please let me know if it would be helpful to chat, and thanks as always. 
best, 
From: (OPR) <

AUSP

As you and I have briefly discussed OPR wishes to conduct brief interviews, on very limited and historical matters, with a 
number of individuals who may be involved in matters you have under investigation, who are listed below. You offered to 
advise us which of the individuals you know to be currently represented by counsel, and who those counsel are. For 
efficiency's sake, I would like to schedule a phone call with you for that purpose. Please let me know when you might be 
available. 
As are so many of us, I'm teleworking, but available to speak at pretty much any time of the workday. 
With regards, 
Counsel
